1.content:
You are just waking up because you feel uncomfortable in the position you are sleeping in. It feels like you were sleeping on a rock. When you wake up, you realize, you are sleeping on a rock. You wake up confused and puzzled.
"How did I get out here?" you ask yourself as you look around and try to figure out where you are.
You pan around and notice there is a long stretch of dirt as far as the eye could see. You look behind you and you look in horror as you see a long wall of giant blades of grass.
"OH MY GOD!!" you say in shock. "I'M SHRUNK!"
Then you look at the grass then you, as you estimate you are no bigger then a half an inch. How did this happen? You can't remember a thing. You try to look even higher then the grass to see what is over it. And to your amazement, you see that you are not on earth anymore. You are in ponyville, half an inch tall, in ponyville. You begin to cry a little being you've always wanted to go there someday. But you don't think like this. So you try to look around to see what you can see anything familiar, and you see.............
1.title: Where Am I?!

choices: Twilight and Spike walk in, discussing something.
11.content:
Books. Lots of books. Books beyond counting, and many off the shelf. Towering over you is a work desk with what you can just make out as a pot of ink, a quill and several sheets of paper. There's only one place you know of that looks like this.

It's a Library of somekind?

This gets your hopes up. If this was the correct library, then it was also the home of Twilight Sparkle - one of the smartest Unicorns you can think of. Smart and studious, she'd definitely be the right one to help you figure out exactly what was going on. That is, if she was in.

Sure enough, the floor shakes and you have a difficult time finding a hiding spot. It isn't long before a towering titan comes in - a rough guess places the figure at well over 800ft tall, assuming you were still your normal height. Fortunately, they don't appear to have seen you just yet.

But who was the figure?
11.title: Silence in the Library

111.content:
The titanic figure you find yourself staring up at as it approaches is, go figure, that of Twilight Sparkle herself. The illustrious owner of the Ponyville Library herself. She walks, or rather, to you, stomps inside the library humming to herself. Her voice was loud and echoed, but still retained it's feminine pitch like it usually did. Upon closer hearing you can assume that she's humming the Winter Wrap-Up song happily.

You decide that you need to grab her attention. After all, she's the only one here, and you're not exactly sure as to how you wound up in Equestria in the first place, let alone on a desk in Twilight Sparkle's library. You run up to the edge of the desk and begin to wave your arms up as Twilight approaches the desk, still humming. It seems that as you flail your limbs about and shout up at her, she can't exactly hear you, so you decide to try to grab her attention another way.

Looking around, you find a small needle, possibly one for sewing, that Rarity may have left behind in a previous visit of this place as it was white and quite polished. You pick the needle up in one hand (it really isn't that heavy, even at this size, and it was about the size of a longsword for you) and quickly stab Twilight's fur in one area. The tactic seemed to have worked as Twilight squeaks with minor pain from the small prick she just felt and she immediately looks down in your direction.

Her eyes don't seem to change as she looks down on your tiny form. She just tilts her head and smiled sweetly down at you. However, your nerves were getting the better of yourself. After all, having a being that is no less that 800 feet tall by your standards stare down at you isn't good for one's nerves. You began to shake a bit and breathe faster, an obvious reaction of fear.

Twilight giggled and got a little closer and moved her head down to the desk, and spoke in a softer voice...
111.title: Surprise, Surprise! It's Twilight!

choices: "...Why don't you tell me all it?"
"...Why don't I get you some Tea?"
Your interrupted as someone else walks (stomps?) in.
1111.content:
By this point however, you were already running. You weren't even aware you were doing it, but you were - your little legs trying to carry you to safety away from the titanic purple horse. You look back at her before -

WHAM.

You ran into something soft and round. Twilight had put up a hoof to stop you from running away. There's a slight feeling of pressure, and a second hoof picks you up harmlessly. She's carrying you up to her chest before - you don't quite believe this is happening.

She's giving you the biggest hug of your life.

You are completely swamped in Purple, but not crushed or uncomfortable - she seems to be taking great care in trying not to hurt you at all. As you look up, her face is looking down at you.

"I'm sorry, did I scare you?" she asked, her voice sincere. She softly rubs your head with one of the hooves. "You look like you needed something to help you stay calm. Now..."
1111.title: "Hello there, you cute little creature!"

11112.content:
"Here, why don't I go get you some tea? You thirsty?" you nodded quickly up at Twilight, now much calmer. She grinned and set you back down on the desk, taking a few steps away from you towards her kitchen.

"Just stay right there, okay? I'll be back in a bit!" with that, she disappeared from your view, presumably into her kitchen to make the tea. You decide to sit down and just wait. Hopefully she wouldn't be too long, as the silence that permeated the air of the library around you made you feel a little ill at ease. You cast your wandering eyes all around yourself, and gaze in awe at the surroundings. Sure, the Library was a pretty aethetically pleasing place, being all organized properly, but at your size, it made it seem as though it had all the knowledge about everything in the entire universe!

You blink a few times as you hear the stomping hoofsteps again. Twilight must be coming back with the tea it seemed, and go figure, you were correct. Twilight Sparkle quickly rounded the corner, using her magic to levitate two small cups of fresh steaming tea. She appeared to still be smiling sweetly and humming to herself as she approached the desk. Upon her arrival, she quickly sets them both down and smiles at you again.

"Here, lemme shrink your cup a bit for you. I don't want you to burn yourself in the tea," She looked down at your teacup and quickly casts a small magic spell on it, causing it to shrink until it was about the average size of one of Earth's teacups. You quickly pick it up and drink it, enjoying it's very sweet taste, but you couldn't help but feel that you've tasted this kind of tea before...

Shaking the feeling off you and Twilight both finish your tea together, and you let out a small sigh of relaxation. Wow, that tea really hit the spot. It relaxed you so much. Twilight returned your teacup to it's original size and giggled at your lethargy.

"Heh, you humans are just too cute when you're tired!" she reached her head down and nuzzled your form before turning around and leaving you alone while she goes and cleans the teacups out in her kitchen. It was then that the realization hit you, and you sit upright in a flash.

She just referred to you as a human! The thought that Twilight even knew what humans were in the first place was astonishing, but the fact that she doesn't seem at all phased by your appearance in her LIbrary was just mind-blowing. Suddenly, there's a knock on the front door of Twilight's library.

"I'll get it!" Twilight's voice boomed out as she called to the door. She quickly rushed out and opened the door with her magic, revealing...
11112.title: Tea Time with Twilight

choices: Rainbow Dash has found something more interesting than a book - you!
Twilight returns with the book(s) without incident.
111121.content:
Sure enough, there's a large blue Pegasus standing at the doorframe. One look at that mane, and you instantly knew who it was.

Unfortunately, instinct didn't quite agree. You decide it's for the best if you remain hidden for Dash's visit, and instinctively hide under the saucer with Twilight's tea cup. Fortunately, so does Twilight. You can hear her conversation with Dash from where you are sitting, and so far she hasn't even mentioned you - maybe she has plans later? Maybe she wants her own little Human companion? Or maybe she just thinks introducing you to her friends in your state of up and down emotions isn't a good idea. Whatever the reason, you were thankful...for the time being. You could still hear them talking from the other side of the room...

"...Rainbow, I told you! The next Daring Doo book isn't out until next week!" you heard Twilight protest as she took the book from Rainbow.

"Well, I'm going to need something to do while I wait until then." Rainbow replied, sounding almost down. She must be really anticipate that book.

"Maybe you can try reading something else?" Twilight asked.

"...Maybe I could borrow out a few I borrowed previously?" Rainbow asked. "No offence Twilight, but I'd rather stick with one book series for now."

You heard Twilight groan - clearly getting Rainbow to have a diverse range of books she liked was harder than it sounded. Then things started going badly - for you anyway.

Twilight left the room, going to find Dash her books no doubt. This left you and Dash alone in the room together. You try to keep yourself together, but the reality of the situation keeps getting the better of you. Dash herself was always one of the more aggressive Ponies - moreso as of second season, you knew. Revealing yourself would be a very, very bad idea...
111121.title: More Horses

choices: To quickly make her getaway with you!
To go show you off to Twilight.
1111211.content:
You shiver from beneath the teacup saucer as Rainbow Dash began to trot around the Library. Just the mere thought of what she might and could possibly do to you opened a primal fear of the mare in you. She began to idly hum what sounded like a rock song in her head as she looked around idly. And eventually, she finally made her way over to your personal bubble. Your desk, and more importantly, your hiding space.

Your eyes practically bugged out, and your shaking at this point caused the saucer to shake slightly as well as Rainbow Dash approached, making small clattering noises against the hardwood surface. It also wasn't of much help that you also began to whimper with terror.

Rainbow Dash, of course, began to hear a series of small sounds coming from the direction of the desk. Her ears flicked a few times in response.

"Huh? What's that sound?" to her, your whimpering sounded like tiny squeaks to her. She looked directly down at the shaking saucer and used her light blue hoof to move it aside, revealing you, curled up, shaking and squeaking. Rainbow Dash immediately gasped in surprise. You slowly look up with your eyes, now welled up with tears of fright, as Rainbow Dash's eyes widened and glittered with amazement and surprise. You uncurl yourself, shaking now more than ever, and quickly take off running away from her. Of course, you squeak in minor pain when you are suddenly stopped in your tracks, feeling a slight pressure around your torso as Rainbow Dash lifted you up to her face, now smiling.

"Ooh my gosh! I didn't know Twilight had such a cute little guy like you in here!" While in her grip, Rainbow Dash felt you shaking as you looked at her with eyes filled with terror, a few tears rolling down your cheeks. Rainbow Dash didn't seem to care as she very roughly cuddled you against her cheek, causing you to squeak and sniffle a bit, still afraid.

Rainbow Dash then decides....
1111211.title: Rainbow's Finding

choices: "Okay, but I want to make sure he's okay with it."
11112112.content:
Rainbow hums idly as she carries you along on her muzzle, bouncing you a few times and generally having fun as she walks into the back room where Twilight was hard at work.

"Hey Twilight! Look what I found!" Rainbow shouted. If you could see it, she had a child-like look of glee on her face as she beamed at Twilight brightly. Twilight however, was a bit pre-occupied.

"Rainbow, if this is another Book of Evil, I'm gonna-"

Twilight stops mid sentence as her eyes lock onto you. She immediately bounds over and hastily examines you.

"Rainbow, you startled him!" Twilight scolded.

"Well, yeah...I mean you were hiding and he kept making these weird squeaky noises." Rainbow explained "For an egghead Twilight, your not very good at hiding stuff."

Twilight let the insult slide. "Rainbow, this is a Human. They're a very shy and panicky species from another world." she explained. "They need sympathy and protection from us, not being juggled around on our muzzles."

Rainbow immediately felt slightly sorry for you.

"Besides." Twilight added "how would YOU like it if some monster came along and started using YOU as a plaything?"

Rainbow was quiet for a few moments.

"I'm sorry Twilight. I guess I just got carried away." she replies "I'll take good care of him from now on, Pinkie promise!" she added. Twilight looked at Rainbow cautiously.

"You'll do what?" Twilight asked.

"Well yeah. Think about it. I have wings AND my home's in the sky. He's more of a secret up there than down here where someone might have seen him. Someone like Rarity probably."

Twilight thought about it. Rainbow did have a certain logic behind her thinking. Her thoughts however, did also side track to the one pony this could have ended worse with. She turns back to Rainbow and replies...
11112112.title: Epic L00t!

choices: "Let's try testing harmless magic on you."
111121122.content:
Twilight eventually sighs and shakes her head.

"I can't let you take him to your home, Rainbow Dash. It could be dangerous for the poor guy. We don't even know if he can walk on clouds," Rainbow gave Twilight puppy eyes and began to try to come up with a way to try to keep you.

"B-But Twilight...! We could, uh... we could use your cloud-walking spell on him! That way, he'll be safe!" Twilight thought about this for a second before shaking her head again.

"While that would be a good idea, I'm not even sure if he's sensitive to our magic. Remember, he comes from a world that doesn't have magic in it." Rainbow sighed and eventually seemed to give up. Twilight sighed as well before shrugging.

"Tell you what. You leave him here in my care. You can come visit him whenever you'd like and whenever you're free, okay?" Rainbow's expression immediately lit up and she nodded, shaking you up and down her muzzle a bit, causing you to squeak.

"Careful there, Rainbow. Anyways, that sounds like a good plan. I'm gonna have to keep him in a cage or something whenever I'm not watching him, especially if Rarity comes here and thinks he's a bug."

"So it's settled then?" Twilight nods.

"Yes, but just promise me this one thing. Don't tell the other girls about him, alright? I'll show them after I've done a bit of studying. Until then, you can come visit him, just be sure that you don't let anypony know."

"You have my word, Twilight!" Rainbow grinned, lifting you off her muzzle and gently cuddling you against her cheek. "He's just too cute!" Twilight giggled.

"Heh, I didn't know you had a soft spot for cute things, Rainbow Dash." Rainbow blushed a bit and stopped cuddling you.

"Yeah, well... you saw how I reacted during the whole parasprite invasion." Twilight smiled and nodded before taking you off of Rainbow's head with her magic, placing you on her bed.

"Well, for now, I should get going, Twilight. I'll come back to see if you have the next Daring Do book out, okay?"

"It won't be out until next week, Rainbow Dash." With that, Rainbow Dash headed back downstairs and quickly left the Library. Twilight then turned her attention back to you.

"Now then... let's just get some of the studies out of the way first, alright? What to begin with..."
111121122.title: "Absolutely not!"

choices: Twilight gives you a simple puzzle to solve
Twilight puts it to one side, and decides to have a round of twenty questions
1111211221.content:
Twilight is quick to pick you up with her magic, before carrying you over to a desk that looked cluttered. While your suspended, Twilight had kept a number of different academic instruments - many you recognized, from Microscopes to Compasses - some on the other hand looked outright weird and bizarre, and clearly unfamiliar.

Probably used to measure other things you thought to yourself.

Once Twilight had cleared the desk, you are levitated onto it. The first thing she uses however is a ruler.

"About 0.1 Hands tall. That's...really tiny." Twilight replied while scribbling the notes down "something as small as you shouldn't really be so smart."

You look a little offended. "W-What does that mean?" you reply, sounding slightly angry while reminding yourself that you were in the presence of a skyscraper sized Horse-Like Monster. She need only inhale to finish you off.

"Well, your capable of very complex brain activity for your size. Something like you shouldn't even have knowledge of Common, let alone be able to interact properly. Actually, speaking of..."
1111211221.title: Fancy Mathematics

choices: "Take you to a friend's house for a little while?"
11112112212.content:
Twilight set a few things down and decided to pick up her clipboard and a quill that was already dabbed with a bit of ink. She looked down at you and gave you a small smile.

"I'm just going to ask you a few questions. They're ranged from science to mathematics to just basic questions. Ready?"

You nod up to Twilight with confidence. You knew you excelled with most sciences and mathematics.

"I'm ready. Let's see what you've got."

Twilight smiled and looked at her clipboard, writing a few things down.

"First question. Give me at least four examples of vital organs inside a living creature's body."

"Brain, heart, lungs, and liver!"

Your answer instantly came flying out of your mouth. Twilight gave you a surprised look and wrote something down.

"Okay, good. Next, what element reacts violently with water? There's more than one answer to this."

"Potassium!"

"What is the product of 25690 and 437.8?"

You thought for a bit, doing the math inside your head for Twilight rather quickly before answering her.

"11247082!"

Twilight's jaw almost dropped. You could hear her gasp at how quickly you solved the answer. Soon, however, she grinned and continued to ask quite a few questions, every one of them you gave what you thought was the correct answer.

This whole questioning process continued for at least two hours, with Twilight giggling and cheering at how many you had answered correctly. She sighed with relief at the end of her last question and set her clipboard and quill down.

"Alright! You answered 150 questions, and you got about 148 of them correct!" She clapped her hooves together and couldn't help but give you a gentle nuzzle. "I'm so impressed! I didn't know humans had the capacity for such intelligence!"

"Heh. Thank you, Twilight." You looked up near a clock in Twilight's room, checking the time. Twilight saw this and turned to the clock as well.

"It's about... 3 in the afternoon. And since we're just about done here... how's about we..."
11112112212.title: The Purple Inqusition

111121122121.content: so which friend's house did she take you?

choices: Rarity (hopefully she doesn't think of you as a bug)
1111211221212.content: Who does Twilight take you to?
1111211221212.title: some pony else

choices: Dash answers the door, eagerly awaiting your arrival for some reason.
Dash isn't there - Twilight needs to look elsewhere.
111121122122.content:
Without a moment's hesitation, you were swept up by the purple Unicorn. While you'd certainly argue with her about the wisdom of it (and a slight phobia of other Colossi), it was probably for the best if you went with her anyway. After all, who knows what would happen if someone like Spike, Rarity or even Pinkie found you?

Twilight looked around for a few books, using a simple walk on clouds spell for herself, but she didn't use it on you. You of course asked why.

"Well, there's no telling what effect Spells might have on you so far. I'd rather play it safe than have my little human get flipped inside out."

The thought of having your insides spilled out in such a manner sends a shudder down your spine, but you quickly forget about it and try to think of the positive - Twilight will be there, presumably at all times. You were going to be in good hands - err, hooves.

A few minuites later, and Twilight had unteathered her Balloon so she could start looking for Dash in a most likely spot - her House. As the pair of you arrive...
111121122122.title: "We're off to see the Pegasus..."

choices: She loses her train of thought and strokes you with her hoof gently.
1111211221221.content:
Twilight quickly approached the front door of Rainbow Dash's cloud house with you resting on her head and knocked on the door with her hoof just once. As she drew her hoof back, the door suddenly opened up to reveal Rainbow Dash and her smiling, eager face.

"Gah!" Twilight yelped and stopped her hoof in the middle of its approach to Rainbow Dash's forehead. You were shaken around a bit by Twilight's jump and held onto her horn tightly to prevent falling off. Rainbow Dash squealed with joy as she saw you resting on Twilight's head, instantly grabbing you from her as she held you in her own hoof.

"Eee! She brought you back~!" Dash just giggled and cuddled you against her cheek. Twilight just groaned and stepped into her living room and closing the door behind her.

"Rainbow Dash, can you at least pay attention to me for just two minutes? I only came up here for two minutes..."

Rainbow Dash turned around and gave Twilight her full attention, placing you on top of her soft rainbow mane. Twilight smirked at how cute the scene looked.

"Well, I've studied all I could without getting too in depth, Rainbow Dash. I can't try magic or any scientific experiments. Mostly because I don't want to hurt the little guy,"

Rainbow Dash nodded understandingly.

"Okay, and...?"

Twilight sighed.

"I need to leave him with you for now as a pet while I go and ask Princess Celestia for some time. Okay?"

At this statement, the smile that quickly and almost instantly spread across her face was indescribable. She squealed again and dashed over to hug Twilight.

"Thankyouthankyouthankyou!" she squeaked before she suddenly flew right back up to her bedroom, landing on her bed instantly and placing you down in front of her. Twilight sighed and smirked.

"I have a feeling they're going to get along nicely."

In Rainbow Dash's room, however, you felt yourself shivering a little bit as you found yourself staring up at the massive mare before you, her wide, gleeful amethyst eyes looking down at you. She giggled and nuzzled you.

"Hey. I've got an idea little guy, how's about we..."
1111211221221.title: They Don't call her Dash for Nothing.

choices: Find a hiding place and stay there; you can't outrun her.
Hide, but try to dart around if Rainbow spots you.
11112112212211.content:
You blink and take an impulsive step back. "A... game?" You parrot, trying not to sound nervous. Rainbow would never dream of hurting you, that's obvious... but there's still danger. Given Rainbow's aggressive personality, her normal roughhousing could be dangerous at your size. Still, it's not like she would go out of her way to hurt you...

         Rainbow nods, giggling. "Yep! We don't know how long Twilight will be gone, and she asked me to watch ya 'till then." Suddenly, she roughly flops onto her stomach, resting her head on crossed forelegs. The impact is enough to stagger you, and you barely manage to avoid falling on your rear. You throw an annoyed glare up at Rainbow, and she responds with a chuckle. "Now, I'm not one to sit around and twiddle my hooves, but I know I can't leave you here--too dangerous--and taking you into town with me just makes more problems." Smirking, she swiftly rises to her hooves and stands on her bed, towering over you once more. "Sooo, that leaves us with one option: kill time 'till Twilight gets back!"
         Gently--but without warning--Rainbow scoops you up in a hoof and brings you up to her face. "And I've got a prefect idea for the first game: a little something I call 'Keep-Away!'" She lowers you to the floor--oddly firm for something made of clouds--and hops off her bed, landing in front of you... A little too closely for your liking: there's almost no danger of getting crushed, but Rainbow's size and impact are enough to cause an instinctual fear to surface. You yelp and flinch back, never taking your eyes off the huge pegasus.

         "Hey, don't be afraid. I'm not gonna hurt you or anything," Rainbow soothed, gently petting you with a hoof. When you calm down, she snaps back to her playful mood. "Now, the rules of Keep-Away are simple: you just have to avoid me, in any way you can: run, hide, dodge, anything." She was leaning down at you, putting her massive muzzle not that far from your face. It gets in your personal space a bit, but it's not as intimidating as just towering over you and looking down.
Then Rainbow adopts a new posture: crouching low, forelegs locked at angle as if ready to pounce. She's at roughly eye-level with you now, which gives you a great view of her smirk.
Suddenly, you wish you'd stayed with Twilight.
"As for me," Rainbow concludes, swishing her tail through the air behind her, "I have to try to catch ya! Since we're inside, I can't do much fancy flying, though. So I'm hoofing it!" She crouches even lower, her smirk widening. "Just keep away from me as long as you can... I'll give you a ten-second head start, so get moving--let's have some fun!"

         You know this is dangerous. You know that you should try to talk Rainbow out of this. And you know that the idea of leading Rainbow on a wild goose chase through her house is humiliating. None of that stops you from running full tilt away from Rainbow, out of her room. Her voice follows you out into the hallway.

         "Nine... Eight... Seven..."

         Okay, gotta get into gear. How should I...Keep-Away from Rainbow?
11112112212211.title: "Let's play a game!"

111121122122112.content:
"Seven... "

You keep running down the hallway, glancing around your surrounding for a good place to hide.

"Six... "

You pick up the pace a little and notice several doors on either side of the hallway, the closest one was a couple of strides in front of you to your left, but odds are she would check that one...

"Five... "

Based of your speed you figure you can just make it to the next door on your right before she gets to one.

"Four... Three... Two... "

You quickly get to the door and drop down on your belly before rolling to your right and underneath the small gap between the door and the floor. You take a quick glance around and notice your in the kitchen, which has a little walk out patio, and just beyond that was a pool of what appeared to be liquid rainbow, similar to that from off of the show.

"One... Zero... Ready or not here I come!" Her voice echoes through the house. You look to your right and notice a line of cabinets, and one of them was slightly open. You decide to go for it as you feel the ground shake a little as Rainbow Dash starts running down the hallway. You hear a door open and take a quick glance over your shoulder. "Whew... " you let out a sigh of relief as you realize she must have went into that first room you decided against. Shaking you head to regain you concentration you turn to the cabinet and squeeze through, closing the door behind you, and waiting in the dark, listening. After about a minute you hear her come out of the room and the vibrations going through the floor pick up as she continues down the hallway, towards your location. There is a loud creak as the door to the kitchen is opens, your heart starts to beat a little fast and you start heading toward the back of the cabinet, our the side, you lost all sense of direction, but mainly you were walking away from the noise of her walking. You run into what feel like cardboard boxes, you feel your way around and behind them trying your best to get as far away from that cabinet door as possible. After making some progress you hear a cabinet door open and take a quick look behind you, still pitch black. You come across another box that seems to be opened, you slowly put you hand in into it, not sure what you expect to feel. Pretty soon you are touching the bottom of the box, the box is empty! With that thought you jump in and pull the flaps together, not completely closed, but cracked enough so you can see what is going on. After a couple more seconds you hear the cabinet door close and then your world is flooded with light as Rainbow Dash opens the cabinet you are hiding in. She starts to pull boxes of what appear to be different pantry items, like cookies, cereal, some oatmeal look a like. Eventually there are only a couple of boxes left and she has to put her head in the cabinet so she has enough arm length to pick up the remaining boxes, unfortunately the first box she reaches for is yours and you can feel you heart beating faster and faster until you are sure you hear it drumming in you ears. You feel the box slide forward as she pulls it toward her until she gets her hoof under it to bring it up to her face for inspection, about half way up you jump out of the box and make a diving leap out of the cabinet.

"Gotcha!" Rainbow shouts as she backs her head out of the cabinet so she can grab you. You meanwhile are sprinting as fast as your little legs can carry you, adrenaline coursing through your veins as you fear what would happen if Rainbow Dash accidentally crushes you. You feel the ground beneath you start to shake as she gets closer, and soon you can even hear her breathing. You get running full speed ahead, right for the patio. Then the unexpected happens, you trip, you start falling forward and you look behind you as you fall, Rainbow Dash only a couple of paces behind you. You hit the floor and turn around to see Rainbow Dash slam on the brakes, all four hooves on the ground, she even opens her wings to aid in slowing herself down. You let out a small yelp as she finally stops, her front to hooves within a human arm length from your body. You body starts shaking as you realize how close you just came to becoming a smear. Rainbow Dash, oblivious to your shaking reaches down and picks you up saying "You did better than I thought you would, but what was that? Can't even keep your balance?" She then brings you back up to your face and begins to nuzzle you again, calming you down, and you start to pet you soft cyan colored fur. After a couple of seconds she pulls you away from her and....

As Rainbow nuzzles you, your adrenaline rush abates as exhaustion suddenly takes hold and with a groan, you flop onto your back, lying balanced on her hoof. You try to catch your breath and relax, but dizziness and lingering fear prevent that. Woah... that was *intense,* goes through your head as Rainbow continues nuzzling you. I'm *still* surrounded by monstrously huge cartoon equines.

If there have been other humans in Equestria before, and the ponies know about them... maybe you could find out how you got here in the first place, and find a way home! With a burst of newfound energy, you run to Rainbow's forehead, reach a tiny arm down and wave it in front of her eyes to get her attention. "Rainbow, wait! Go back to the front page!" You call out. In a rush of excitement, you stand up on her mane and you flail about some more. There's a short pause, and Rainbow looks upwards and cocks an eyebrow. Taking the prompt, you elaborate, "One of the articles--it said something about other humans!"

Which causes you to lose your footing and go tumbling rear-over-teakettle off her head. The world spins and tumbles around you, and with a string of yelps, you roll down Rainbow's neck and down her back (passing right between her wings on the way down), until with a slight *thud* you finally land flat on your back on the couch, dazed and slightly annoyed. You shake your head clear, and find that yourself looking up at a... mural? ...of a cartoon lightning bolt in rainbow colors. As the last of your dizziness fades, you recognize it as Rainbow's cutie mark.

         Should I make a "Dat Plot" reference now? It's a bit vulgar, but this set-up is just perfect... Your innuendo-related musings are cut short when you notice Rainbow looking down at you sheepishly, even blushing a bit. With a nervous chuckle, she scoops you up in a hoof.

         "Uh, sorry about that little guy," Rainbow apologizes, rubbing the back of her head with a free hoof. "Didn't mean to send you flying like that..." She gently places you back on her head and picks the paper back up, this time turned to the front page.

         "Ah, don't worry about it. I'm fine, and I can't blame you for being surprised," you reply, shrugging it off. But I CAN blame you for not giving me a warning! You add mentally. Rainbow gives you a quick smile, but you both adopt tense expressions as you read the article.

Sightings of Humans More Common? Probable Causes/What To Do

Our fair Equestria seems to have become a magnet for strange, new creatures.

"Strange and new?" That was odd. Twilight knew what you were, and that you were from a different world, so the ponies had encountered humans before, or at least knew of them. But whoever wrote this was acting like humans' presence here just started recently. Shaking the thoughts aside, you continue reading.

First, it was the dark swarm of Changelings that revealed themselves. The despicable insects came out of nowhere and nearly seized Canterlot just a few months ago--indeed, some of the damage still awaits repairs. The shape-shifters were defeated, (thanks to the good Captain Armour and his bride) but now something new appears yet again: in the past few weeks, sightings of Humans have been increasing almost exponentially. Indeed, what was once a fanciful tale for the taverns has been told across Equestria, from Stalliongrad to Las Pegasus. There have been reports and sightings of the small bipeds almost all over our great nation... and yet to this reporter's knowledge, none have been captured and most trails have gone cold. Even more worrisome, almost nothing seems to be known about these small, mysterious creatures, especially why they are coming in such great numbers to our world. Word on the street ranges from random dimensional shifts, to something as drastic as an invasion. I will not theorize on the cause, because although most layponies are in the dark, there are undoubtedly those who may be more knowledgeable on humans than I. Perhaps musical prodigy Lyra Heartstrings of Ponyville is correct when she says that Humans are no threat to us.

But consider this, readers: Recall the Changelings. Yes, they were soundly defeated; their hive waved the white flag rather than fight us. But even now we are still making new and shocking discoveries about this previously-unknown race. We also know little of humans, it seems. So, will *they* also prove dangerous? That, like them, is unknown.

         It gets worse from there: the sensationalist tone never letting up, the writer (you don't want to think of anypony who writes this kind of fear-mongering garbage as a reporter), giving "tips" on how to catch and trap humans--even a net is recommended, which makes you feel sick--and through the whole rag, there are those odd comparisons to the Changelings. By the time you're done reading, Rainbow has already thrown the paper against the wall in disgust; she even wipes her hooves on the couch like she'd held something filthy. "Ugh! I should have recognized that writing," Rainbow snarls. She sounds oddly... angry, like that tabloid personally offended her. "I don't know how Saber Rattler ever got a job with Equestrian Voice, they're a classy newspaper! They shouldn't work with somepony like her!"

         You raise an eyebrow, intrigued at Rainbow's sudden bad mood. "Sabre Rattler?" You inquire.

         Rainbow snorts. "She's some wannabe tabloid writer in Canterlot--always whipping up trouble with that so-called column of hers. Especially since the Wedding! Almost every day, she would be wailing about how 'our security is paper-thin!' or 'is the Royal Guard really up to the task?'. Hardly any truth to it, just blowing up the story for shock! And you know what's worse? After we finally found the Changelings' hive and they surrendered, she just changed her tune like nothing happened! Now, she's been going off about how Celestia should just throw the whole hive into the sun, and all the Changelings with it--even the kids!" Now Rainbow's temper flares even more, and she angrily kicks a pillow off the couch. You can't blame her; you feel disgusted yourself. Sleazy tabloid types are nothing new, but to just change their story like that when they were proved wrong? That was just cowardly. And then there was the bit about destroying the Changeling hive--it was transparent fear-mongering, nothing more. Sabre Rattler definitely lived up to her name.

         "Hey, I'm no fan of the hack," you announce, making Rainbow chuckle. "But still, she did name-drop Lyra--" And apparently she IS a human fan! "--so maybe we have a lead there. Turns out her tabloid is useful." You can't help but smile as Rainbow's good mood returns, and she takes you off her head for a quick nuzzle. As she puts you on her shoulder, you think of something. "Hey, what's with all the Changeling name-dropping? The article was about..well, me, kinda."

         Rainbow laughs. "Ha! Well, Ms. Rattler had a little run-in with the Changelings back at the wedding. To get away from 'em, she hid in a tank of ink, and ended up getting stuck, for hours... the hack had black stains all over her for a week! Left a trail when she walked, too!" You both burst into laughter at the image of a blackened, ink-stained hack tabloidist. Suddenly there's a knock at the door, and Rainbow slips you back onto her head as she trots over, and opens the door to reveal...

14.content:
You were surrounded by towering grass and giant beautiful flowers. It was so beautiful and peaceful, or at least it would be peaceful if the sounds of propeller blades wasn't ringing in your ears. "Whoa! Hit the deck!" you say as you duck and cover. The sound passes over you. You see they are bees just gathering nectar. "Hehe never seen a bee this close before. Well, I've never been this small before either." All of these ants and ladybugs and crickets started crawling out. It felt like you were on the set of "A Bug's Life". That or "Honey, I Shrunk the Kids", considering how small you are.

A colorful shadow fell over you. You look up and see the source. It's a ginormous butterfly gliding over top of you. It was the most beautiful sight you've ever seen. After it passed over, in the distance, there was a cozy little cottage on a hill. You could see a cat in the window and just by looking at the structure, you knew exactly what it was, and who it belonged to. "That's Fluttershy's cottage right?" you ask a ladybug, and being a cartoon, it nods. Yes, Fluttershy can help you. She is the kindest and most gentle pony in Ponyville. It would feel so nice to meet her, even if she was currently a giant to you.

Just then, all the bugs started getting scared. "Hey, what's wrong guys?" They all ran away into the grassy forests. "Oh dear, something big is coming." Then you hear a crash and the ground quakes. You turn in horror and see a bird towering over you. It was looking at you with hungry eyes. It chirped a bit, then made a horrible hiss. "QUEEQUEE! QUEEQUEE!" you say remembering Bug's Life again. After that, you turned and bolted.

The demon-sized bird had no trouble catching up to you. It crashed down in front of you and blocked every path you tried to take. You really are scared now. And this bird was so fast, one peck could split you in half in one quick sweep. You look around and think quick. Luckily, you find a little hole in the ground. Maybe it's a worm hole. Either way, no second thought, you dove into the hole and took refuge. In good time too, for the bird pecked the ground. It felt like a bottle rocket was set off.

The king sized canary was persistent. It tried to get you in the hole, by trying to peck its way in. It was like a nightmare for you, after it was so peaceful and beautiful. The bird clawed and pecked after you. It hissed and screamed like a demon. You were curled up tearfully shivering. It almost got you, but then something happened.

BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!

There was an earthquake that was growing larger. The bird then flew away in its own fear. This was good and bad. Good because the bird is gone, bad because now something WAY bigger was coming. It was getting too close.

BOOM! BOOM!

"I'm done for." you say as a shadow covered the outside. Then something huge finally touched down.

BOOOOOOM!!!

You look out and see......

Whatever was making the earth shake for you, was also humming a merry tune to herself. You look outside to investigate the source of all this, and you look up in complete awe. It was the very pony who you wanted to see. The very gentle, very kind, very beautiful, Fluttershy. Yes, you always thought that she was very beautiful, naturally. Fluttershy was definitely one of the best ponies that anyone would ever want to meet.

You stand there and gawk at the fact that Fluttershy was standing in front of you, that you forget that she was towering above you, probably about two hundred feet at least. She was smiling, and looking everywhere, except down.

"FLUTTERSHY! HEY! I NEED YOUR HELP! HEY!!" you scream. She didn't even look to see what was making the noise, she couldn't hear you. She then began to raise her hoof to take another step. But unfortunately, her hoof is starting to head your way. You scream and ran for cover. You jump out of the way, just in time too, for her hoof came crashing down where you previously stood. The earth below her quaked and shook hard.

It was so ironic, that a creature so gentle like Fluttershy, could be so massive and powerful to little bugs, like you at the moment. She didn't see or hear you down there, and she almost killed you. You sit there and watch her continue taking quaking stomps forward. 'She must be heading back to her cottage' you thought. This might be your only chance to get to some sort of safety.

Looking for a way to follow, or at least keep up with her, you see a massive hairy pink material dragging the ground. It's her tail. 'Of course, I'll climb her tail, and see if I can get up to her ear, maybe then she'll hear me' you thought. You make no second thoughts, and make a leap for it. You grab a hold of her tail, and get a good grip as she continued to stomp forward. You remember that picture of Fluttershy, "I watch it for the plot.", and you had a very clear, massive view of her plot.

Your fantasies can wait until you're at least safe. Right now, you need to get her attention. So, with no second thought, you begin scaling her tail. It was so soft and smelled of fresh daisies. You couldn't help but rub it against you as you climbed.

As you climb....................

Fluttershy was trotting along, having a relatively average day when:

"Oh my, I just felt something wriggling in my tail!"

She bends around to investigate, and sees but a tiny dot, climbing her hair. She brings her tail around to her front, and grabs you out of the tangle.
Grabbing quickly, but gently, as Fluttershy does.

She brings you round to her face, and you rapidly get a grasp of just how tiny you really are. Her face looks like a skyline, an inch to her seems ten yards to you!

"Oh, I've never seen anything like you before!" she whispers, "What're you called, I wonder?"

Her soft and sweet voice caresses you to answer.

"I'm... a human"

"AH! You talk?" she screams, nearly dropping you, she regains her composure quickly though, calmly stating "The only thing close to your size I've seen talk are the breezies, and you're even smaller! Oh, this is great! I- did you say... a human?"

Bringing you closer to her face, she says, before you can answer "But I thought that humans were on the other side of the crystal mirror, and any that passed through would look like us!"

"Yeah, that's the thing, I'm not... that kind of human. I come from a different place, and I have no idea how I got here. Your the first perso- err, I mean pony, I saw, and I was wondering if you could help me figure out whats going on here, or at least get me back to my normal size- ehm, I'm not normally this small"

"Oh of course, I'm sure some research with my friend Twilight could help, or maybe a trick from this alchemist Zecora." You're surprised, even for Fluttershy she seems to be taking this in stride. In any case, she tucks you in her mane, and is about to fly off to one of the two places when she mutters regretfully "Oh, how rude of me. this decision should be based on your priorities! So, what do you think, talk to Twilight to see if we can get an information on your world, or talk to Zecora and see if we can get you big again!"
